registrar_rules.message: Registrar is Verisign — generally trusted but verify domain controls and DNSSEC.
Registrar appears in outdated or low-security list → possible domain hijack or DNS tampering risk.
Registrar not in major secure registrar list → verify domain lock, 2FA and monitoring.
DNSSEC appears absent → possible DNS spoofing or cache poisoning exposure.
Registrar associated with high-abuse domains → may indicate lax security controls.
Registrar field missing or empty → WHOIS suppression or misconfiguration detected.
Registrar uses outdated contact fields → backend systems may be old or less secure.
Registrar located in high-risk jurisdiction → review domain security posture.
WHOIS recently updated → verify registrar or DNS changes were intentional.
Free-domain registrar detected → historically weak identity verification.

age_rules.message: Domain is very new (<1 year old) → may be transient/test domain; verify trustworthiness.
Domain is relatively new (1–3 years old) → moderate risk; could be recently registered for malicious activity.
Domain is mature (>3 years old) → lower risk, likely stable/legitimate.
Test rule: domain created more than 30 years ago
Test rule: domain updated within the last 2 years
